intro: Anemia villosa var. karwinskyana, commonly known as Karwinsky's hairy anemia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
